category: Articles of Incorporation/Article 35 (Convocation of Board of Directors)
contents: Article 35 (Convocation of the Board of Directors) ① The Chairman shall convene the Board of Directors as necessary, but at least once every three months. Revised on June 8, 2017, ② The Chairman shall be the Chairman of the Board of Directors. However, when the Chairman is unable to perform his duties due to unavoidable reasons, the Vice-Chairman becomes the Chairman in accordance with the order established by the Chairman when appointing the Vice-Chairman. Newly established on June 8, 2017, ③ When convening a board of directors meeting, each director must be notified in writing (including electronic documents) of the agenda, date, and location at least 5 days prior to the meeting. However, if there are urgent reasons, the period may be shortened., ④ If there is a request to convene one of the following items, the Chairman must convene a board of directors meeting within 10 days. Revised April 2, 2018, 1. When the majority of registered directors request a convening by presenting the purpose of the meeting. 2. When the auditor requests a convening in accordance with Article 27, Paragraph 4, Item 4 in relation to the field of duty. ⑤ Notwithstanding Paragraph 4, if the Board of Directors meeting is not convened, the director or auditor who requested the meeting may convene the Board of Directors meeting. In this case, the senior of the directors or auditors who requested a convening (if multiple auditors jointly convene a board meeting) shall have the authority to convene the board of directors, and the senior shall preside and elect the chairman from among the directors present. Revised 2018. 4. 2., 2021. 7. 5., ⑥ The board of directors can only decide on agenda items notified in advance. However, if there is agreement from all directors present, other agenda items may be submitted and decided upon. ⑦ Directors may participate in the resolution when their interests and those of the Sports Council are conflicting due to matters involving the giving or receiving of money or property. ⑧ The board of directors may deliberate and make resolutions by means of remote communication, etc. without all or part of the directors attending the meeting in person, and the necessary matters shall be determined separately. Newly established 2021. 3. 16.
